intro: Tragia elliptica, commonly known as the narrowleaf spurflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elliptical leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Tragia elliptica is used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
